```json
{"solution": {"Original category": "Sale", "Recorded category": "Sale", "Original date": "2024-01-22", "Recorded date": "2024-02-04", "Original payment/receipt_status": "Paid", "Recorded payment/receipt_status": "Paid", "Original payment_method": "Cash", "Recorded payment_method": "Cash", "Original quantity": "1.0", "Recorded quantity": "1.0", "Original price": "14983.40", "Recorded price": "12188.26", "Original receive_method": "Cash", "Recorded receive_method": "Cash", "Original amount": "14983.40", "Recorded amount": "12188.26", "Original tax": "749.17", "Recorded tax": "749.17", "Original profit": "9983.40", "Recorded profit": "9983.40", "Original Preparer": null, "Recorded Preparer": null, "Original Approver": null, "Recorded Approver": null, "id": "Sale20240122045"} }
```
**Rationale:**
- The invoice (standardized description) says: "On January 22, 2024, an invoice was issued for a Sale, consisting of 1.0 units at a unit price of $14983.40, totaling $14983.40..." â€” so Original date = 2024-01-22, Original price = $14983.40, Original amount = $14983.40.
- The recorded data have date = 2024-02-04, price/unit = $12188.26, amount = $12188.26. Other fields are consistent.
- Thus, the internal inconsistency is in the date and price fields, which should match the invoice field. All other fields are as described in the invoice.
